abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Financial Services
            Development Project for Azerbaijan is to increase efficient
            access to financial services in targeted cities, rayon
            centers and rural areas and support adoption of a strategic
            framework for an efficient payment system infrastructure.
            The major changes include: (i) reformulated project
            development objectives (PDO), outcome and component
            indicators and targets to more closely measure the outcomes
            of the original and restructured project expected by the
            closing date; and (ii) reduction of the scope of the
            component two and alignment of its description with changes
            during implementation. The minor changes include: (a)
            reallocation of credit proceeds between disbursements
            categories to meet the project needs; (b) revised project
            financing and costs to reflect changes during
            implementation; and (c) a revised disbursement schedule to
            reflect the initial implementation delays and the recently
            extended implementation period. Expected outcomes include:
            (1) increased efficient access to financial services in
            targeted cities, rayon centers and rural areas; and (2)
            adoption of a strategic framework for an efficient payment
            system infrastructure.
